str2: Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
